title: 2018 Crime Incident Records Request (Pasadena Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting data on crime incidents—those classified by your agency as crimes—rather than calls for service or unfounded incidents.
• Year(s) Requested: 2018
• Columns Requested: Incident date, Incident time, Type of crime (e.g., robbery, theft, etc.), Incident ID, and all other available columns that do not require additional processing by the agency or redaction.

If the data are stored in a proprietary or custom electronic format not publicly available, I request that it be converted to a format viewable with standard software, such as Microsoft Excel or CSV. Please avoid providing data in PDF or paper printouts.

This request is made to support academic research conducted in the public interest and is not for commercial purposes. The data will contribute to a research project assessing the effect of music concerts on crime, aiming to enhance public understanding of how large events influence community safety.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kristina Block

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Arrest of Monika Hladik

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Arrest of Monika Hladik
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Location: Clearwater, FL
Suspect: Monika Hladik, 41
Incident Summary: Hladik, a former managerial accountant for Inspecs USA, was arrested for allegedly embezzling $710,531 from the company between 2016 and 2022. Authorities state that she wrote 232 unauthorized checks to herself, forged her employer’s signature, and manipulated QuickBooks accounting entries to conceal the theft. The investigation began after a complaint was filed by the company president. Hladik was arrested and charged with a scheme to defraud.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Responded to the complaint and conducted any preliminary investigations.
Located and arrested Monika Hladik.
Transported her to the Pinellas County Jail.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: June 27, 2019, July 1, 2019(Arrest)
Location: Clear Sky Cafe, Clearwater, FL
Suspect: Serina Wolfe
Incident Summary: Serina Wolfe allegedly used her boyfriend’s credit card without permission to leave a $5,055.37 tip at Clear Sky Cafe after an argument. The dispute began when Wolfe’s boyfriend refused to buy her a flight home to New York. He placed a hold on his credit card, but once it was removed, Wolfe made the unauthorized transaction. The restaurant was later informed of the fraudulent charge, but the waitress had already received the tip. Wolfe was arrested on July 1st on theft charges and booked on a $2,000 bond.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Responded to Clear Sky Cafe to investigate the incident.
Spoke with the restaurant staff and the victim regarding the unauthorized charge.
Located and arrested Serina Wolfe.
Transported Wolfe to the Pinellas County Jail.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: FBI support for 2020- TV  documentary series "Bloodline Detectives"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI support for 2020- TV  documentary series "Bloodline Detectives"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to FBI support for or collaboration with the production of the 2020- TV documentary series "Bloodline Detectives," hosted by Nancy Grace. Such documents may include, but are not limited to, script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of the FBI and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Bloodline Detectives," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication. I request a search of all locations where such documents might be located, including but not limited to the entertainment liaison offices and communications HQ or similar offices.

Attached is a document, released to me by the FBI in response to a previous FOIA request, confirming that the FBI supported the production of "Bloodline Detectives."

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

communications.subject: Alabama Open Records Law Request: UAB FRS
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Alabama Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I request the NCAA Membership Financial Reporting System revenue and expense reports for fiscal years 2004 & 2024.  Specifically:  

These reports are completed by the athletic department for the National Collegiate Athletic Association for the fiscal years listed above. This report is a multi-page document that had to be submitted to the NCAA in January. It contains 40+ revenue and expense categories, followed by specific breakdowns of each of those categories, by sport and gender. I am requesting the full report, including the detail tables, the “Other Reporting Items” list and the “Statement of Revenues and Expenses” that appears at the end of the report. PLEASE NOTE: The NCAA report is different than the equity report that is sent to the U.S. Department of Education for Title IX compliance.

If your department does not maintain these public records, please let me know who does and include the proper custodian’s name and address.

I prefer to receive the records electronically as an Adobe Acrobat (.pdf) file.

If you choose to deny this request, please provide a written explanation for the denial including a reference to the specific statutory exemption(s) on which you rely.  Also, please provide all segregable portions of otherwise exempt material.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

André Natta, a citizen of Alabama, in coordination with Stacey Brook.

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Peregrine
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act (California Government Code § 6250 et seq.)  I am writing to request access to and copies of all records, documents, communications, and data pertaining to the Modesto Police Department’s use, implementation, or involvement with the "Peregrine" technology or platform provided by Peregrine (https://www.peregrine.io/). All records should be from 1/1/2022 until the date this is processed.

Specifically, I am requesting the following:

Contracts, agreements, and memorandums of understanding related to Peregrine.

Policies, procedures, and guidelines governing the use of Peregrine technology.

Training materials, presentations, or communications regarding the Peregrine platform.

Reports, audits, or assessments evaluating the performance or effectiveness of Peregrine.

Correspondence, including emails and internal memos, that mention "Peregrine" or related terms.  Please also include all email correspondence to any representative using a peregrine.io email address ( *@peregrine.io ) 

If possible, I request that the records be provided in an electronic format. Please inform me of any fees for processing this request prior to fulfilling it. If my request is denied in whole or in part, please justify all deletions by reference to specific exemptions under the law.



I look forward to your response within the legally required timeframe. Please do not hesitate to contact me if you require any further information to process this request.

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

title: release of exibits presented in Indiana vs Richard Alllen

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

With the exception of exhibits that are under seal I am requesting release of all trial exhibits, in the case of the State of Indian vs Richard Allen.  Richard Allen was convicted and sentenced October 31st 2024 and the judge assured that after the gag order was lifted at sentencing trial exhibits would be made public as the transcript is being prepared. She has since then instructed her court reporter to advise the public that possibly someday these will be made available. Considering the length of time I am asking for all exhibits used in the trial that were not sealed.  Indiana Public Records Act "APRA" Indiana Code 5-14-3 et seq requires these exhibits to be made public. Considering the volumne of these exhibits some delay is understandable. Four months is no longer understandable and the excuses given to the media who have requested them are ridiculous.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Christine Calderon

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:


Subject: Request for Public Records - 

Greetings,

I hope this email finds you well. We at Evergreen Solutions, LLC, are conducting a compensation study on behalf of our client and I am writing to make a formal open records request. We are requesting an electronic copy of your staff and faculty (if applicable) database as well as relevant documents such as job descriptions, collective bargaining agreements, and pay plans. I am able to send survey templates to assist with the data collection; however, we will accept data in the manner most convenient for you.

Staff Census Information requested:

Job Titles
Classification Title
Pay Grades
Pay Ranges (Minimum and Maximum)
Actual Salaries
Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) Status
Staff Handbook

I also kindly request answers to the following questions related to the compensation study:

How are salaries adjusted for your organization (e.g., COLA, Longevity, performance, etc.)?
What is your current turnover rate?
What is your current average tenure for an employee?
Date your current compensation plan was implemented.
Date of the last salary adjustment?
How frequently are job descriptions updated?

For the faculty database, I am requesting the following information:

Faculty Census:
Rank (if applicable)
Classification Title (if faculty holds other positions other than teaching such as Dean, Chair, Coordinators,etc)
Highest Degree Held
Pay Grade
Pay Ranges (Min& Max)
Current Step (if on a step plan)
Contract Length (in days and/or months)
Annual Base Salary with no additives
Annual Salary with any additives
Discipline (Not to be confused with department, the distinct/specific subject the faculty member teaches; Ex: Microbiology)
Department
CIP Code (if available - by individual incumbent)

Additionally, copies of the following documents, if available:

Copy of all faculty pay plans
Employee Benefit Information (Holidays Off, Health Insurance, Etc)
Salary Adjustment Policy (Longevity, performance, COLA, etc)
Any Collective Bargaining Agreements
Current Turnover Rate
Current Average Tenure
Date that your current pay plan was implemented
Date of your last salary adjustment to pay plan
How frequently are your job descriptions updated
Do you have a planned salary adjustment to your compensation structures for the next fiscal year? If so, by what amount?
Please list/attach and supplements/additives that faculty are compensated for duties outside of instruction
Faculty Handbooks
Adjunct Rates/Pay Plan
Overload Rates
Rates for compensation for faculty leadership- Deans, Coordinators, Department Chairs
Do you compensate faculty differently based on area of discipline? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have any form of additional compensation for Large Class Size? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have an education incentive at your institution? If yes, please provide details.

I understand that public records requests may involve administrative processes and associated fees, as allowed by law. Please inform me of any fees and the estimated timeframe for fulfilling this request. If any portion of this request is denied, please provide a written explanation for the denial, citing the specific legal grounds for the refusal.

Please consider this email as a formal request for public records under the applicable open records laws. If there are any questions or additional details needed to process this request, please do not hesitate to contact me.

I look forward to your prompt attention to this matter and the timely provision of the requested information. Your cooperation in ensuring transparency and access to public records is greatly appreciated.

Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to mandatory exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive?: Yes
Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to discretionary exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive? Yes

Email: alisia@consultevergreen.com

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alisia Rios

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: All emails about Chick-fil-A shooting
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide all emails, reports, meeting summaries, and call summaries related to the Chick-fil-A shooting. For reference, the incident occurred on March 1. Responsive records should include any documents generated before, during, or after the incident. Given the evolving situation, I request that records be provided on a rolling basis as they become available.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian McCarter

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: July 20, 2023
Location: 7000 block of East Drive, North Bay Village, FL
Suspect: Crystal Alisha Brewster, 33
Incident Summary: Brewster was arrested for allegedly defrauding a taxi driver and committing battery on a person aged 65 or older. The incident occurred after she failed to pay the full fare for a taxi ride, engaged in a physical altercation with the driver, and was later identified and detained by police. Surveillance footage reportedly confirmed the victim’s account, and an officer from North Miami Police assisted in translating for the victim.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Responded to the initial call.
Participated in detaining or arresting Brewster.
Conducted any interviews with Brewster or the victim.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Harun

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Location: Olivia’s Subs & Pizza, New Port Richey, FL
Suspect: Syeda Saleem, 28
Incident Summary: Syeda Saleem allegedly threw slices of pizza at restaurant owner Fatos Cala after a dispute over her order. Saleem ordered a margarita pizza but received a plain cheese pizza. When she requested a refund, Cala added basil to the pizza, but Saleem claimed the cheese was rotten and demanded a full refund. Cala refused but offered to make a new pizza. Saleem allegedly threw pizza at Cala, hitting him in the chest and face, then fled the scene. She was later arrested at her home and booked into the Pasco County Jail on a battery charge.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Responded to Olivia’s Subs & Pizza and documented the incident.
Spoke with Fatos Cala regarding the alleged battery.
Located and arrested Syeda Saleem at her residence.
Transported Saleem to the Pasco County Jail.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – August 28, 2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: August 28, 2024
Location: Corner of 16th Avenue and 3rd Street, Naples, FL
Suspect: Teresa Heitmann, 61
Incident Summary: Mayor Teresa Heitmann allegedly followed a couple home in her vehicle while intoxicated, crashed into their mailbox, and parked on their lawn. When police arrived, Heitmann identified herself but later insisted, “I am not the mayor.” Officers noted signs of intoxication, including slurred speech and difficulty standing without leaning on her vehicle. She performed field sobriety tests and later registered blood alcohol levels of 0.155 and 0.169, exceeding Florida’s legal limit of 0.08. She was arrested for DUI with an unlawful BAC of 0.15 or higher.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Responded to the scene and initially spoke with Heitmann.
Conducted field sobriety tests and breathalyzer examinations.
Documented her statements and demeanor during the interaction.
Processed her arrest and transported her to jail.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – July 9, 2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: July 9, 2024
Location: Walgreens, State Road 44, New Smyrna Beach, FL
Suspect: Christopher Morgan, 46
Incident Summary: Morgan allegedly hid in the Walgreens bathroom before closing time, remained inside until after hours, and then helped himself to store merchandise, consuming snacks and beverages. Officers responded to an alarm activation at approximately 3 a.m. and found Morgan inside, taking cigarettes from behind the counter. Upon questioning, he claimed he had entered the store to use the bathroom. Officers recovered multiple partially consumed items from his pockets. During his arrest, Morgan allegedly resisted being placed in a patrol car and spat on an officer. He was charged with burglary, petit theft, resisting an officer without violence, and battery on a law enforcement officer.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Made initial contact with Morgan inside the Walgreens.
Conducted the search and recovered stolen items.
Documented his statements and resistance to arrest.
Transported Morgan to the police station or jail.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

communications.subject: Records Request Confirmation
communications.communication:
Greetings, 
  
 The City Clerk’s Office is receipt of your record request. Thank you for submitting a request for records.

Your request security key is E8DD08F9. 
  
 Your request reference number is Request Number: PRR-262-2025.

Please have this security key and reference number available when communicating with our staff regarding your request. 
  
 Your request will be addressed in the order in which it was received and will be produced within a reasonable amount of time. Should this request criteria be considered large or extensive, the City will provide you with a written estimate, of which a deposit must be paid, prior to records retrieval. Please be advised the statutory obligation of the custodian of public records is to provide access to, or copies of, public records in a reasonable period of time, under reasonable conditions, and under supervision by the custodian or the custodian's designee. However, Florida statutes do not require the custodian of records to provide information about the records produced or to create new records in response to a request. We will notify you upon completion. 
  
 Thank you, 
  
   
  
 Sharon Taylor-Harding 
  
 Interim City Clerk 
  
 City of New Smyrna Beach 
  
 210 Sams Avenue 
  
 New Smyrna Beach, FL 32168
